meanings.definition: The quality of being indelible; permanence.
meanings.sent1: The indelibility of the ink on the paper made it impossible to remove.
meanings.sent2: The indelibility of her memories ensured they would stay with her forever.
meanings.sent3: The indelibility of the marker on the whiteboard led to an unexpected masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was etched in his heart with the indelibility of a tattoo.
meanings.sent5: The indelibility of the sunset painted a lasting image in her mind.

meanings.definition: The state or quality of being unable to be erased or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The indelibility of the message in the sand puzzled the beachgoers.
meanings.sent2: The indelibility of his promise reassured her during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The indelibility of the joke made everyone burst into laughter every time they remembered it.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness left an indelibility in the hearts of those she helped.
meanings.sent5: The indelibility of his smile brightened even the darkest days.
